intro: Stanfieldiella brachycarpa, commonly known as the short-fruited stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and adaptations to arid environments. The plant features compact, rosette-forming foliage with thick, waxy leaves that store water. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white, typically blooming in late spring. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
